comment_0:
Dude, it's a *parody!*  

Eminem's just making fun of all those songs out there that are like "I think I love you baby, I think I love you too..."  etc.  He's basically saying that they're full of shit and guys who say those things are most likey paying their girl lip service to score.

He's also saying (between the lines) that girls who buy this BS are stupid; he's not slamming females in general.

It's strange how intellegent his lyrics can be.
comment_1: im sure a lot of people are gonna get pissed off by this song but im a feminist, and i think this song is kind of sad.  it says a lot about him.  His mother was a drug addict, and it sounds like his wife was a cheating drug addict, so of course he doesn't trust women!  Doesn't sound like he's met one that is worth his time.  If a female came out with a song like this no one would blink an eye, but its true, women can be just as cruel as men.  I wish the best for him, hopefully someday he'll meet someone who really cares about him, so he wont have to put up anymore walls.  Eminem is awesome.

comment_6:
A lot of things in this song are funny (yeah, the anthrax lyric is "pure eminem" as someone said), but it's also a very melancholy and touching song...
The thing I love about it (and about a lot of Eminem's music), is it isn't nearly so mindless as some of the rap you hear where they're just pure "sex fuck bitch whores ima gangsta woo drugs"
There are actual meanings and stories behind his lyrics, and real feelings, and the sounds within the songs give his music a huge touch of personality. (This is partially in response to the person who disagrees with this music btw) Even if some people might take the music "seriously," it is unfortunately because they're too stupid to listen to it closely, and that is something that is unavoidable with any medium (and I don't think that a stable person will actually imitate what they hear in this music anyway). As far as bad treatment of women in his music, yes, it is unfortunate, but it isn't bad treatment of women, and a lot of his songs are really mocking more than anything. (And he does seem to love his daughter and care for her greatly, which implies that it is more that he's jaded, than that he's just inherently an asshole, especially what with bitterness at his mother and his wife, etc etc)
Anyway, regarding this song specifically: it isn't just about hating on women, really. At least, I think it's more about encountering all these fake, whorish women (and perhaps he just attracts them, or it's partially because of his outlook, but nonetheless). It's basically the outpouring of a very very hurt individual who has put a barrier. The lyric "maybe I'll love you one day, maybe we'll some day grow" is very important in this, as well as the lyrics when the girls are talking about being unfazed, in which they're portrayed as trying to prove they can be trusted, even though they more likely just want to hump the guy (and again, vice versa ... eminem obviously feels the same way)
It's just a statement of his state of mind saying that relationship(s?) have fucked him over and he's just too sick of it to care anymore - for now.

comment_100: This song came out at the perfect time in my life.I was still fairly young,I was 25 and going through the worst break up of my life and my best friend committed suicide just a month prior.I had entered a really dark point in my life and needless to say that I was very bitter.In fact,bitter's not even a strong enough word to describe where I was mentally and emotionally.Anyway,I used to put this song on repeat and turn the radio all the way up and belt out the lyrics just because I had it in my head that all women were whores and bitches.Thankfully,as time went on those wounds healed and that anger and misogony dissipated.I still miss my friend something terrible and even now six years later it hurts,but I rarely think about her anymore.In fact when we were together,I was so in love with her that I couldn't even imagine myself with anyone else.Now,however,I can't even picture us together anymore because i'm too different now from back then.I can still listen to this song and get a good chuckle out of it and now I just enjoy the humor in it.But damn,back then this song turned me into a beast.I'm glad I don't feel that way anymore,and hope I never have to feel that way again.
comment_102: People that say Eminem is nothing but a piece of trash and so is all of the music he makes because of all of the explicit material really shouldn't be so shallow and prejudiced in their thinking. To me, this song is about how screwed up things are in the world (what I think the majority of his songs are about), particularly that have to do with relationships. He's not degrading women or anything like that, I think he's simply putting out to the world the things that are really messed up out there. Eminem is no idiot, he's not going to put such extreme ideas out there because he truly believes in them, he's doing it to reveal to everyone what he has only been "lucky" enough to experience. Also, his life definitely never was the bes and still isn't so he's got a lot of problems to rap about. And he came straight out of the gutter with nothing to build off of, so his idea, in my opinion, to get noticed has always been to put out the most attention-grabbing material. Maybe I'm just taking this all naively, but I think everyone should get off his back and at very least appreciate his originality.
